member.name: T:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.AddressDisplayFormat
member.summary: Specifies a value indicating the type of address layout.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.AddressDisplayFormat.InForm
member.summary: Sets the address layout to vertical. Each line in the address contains a single, left-justified element with no separator characters displayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.AddressDisplayFormat.InLine
member.summary: Sets the address layout to horizontal. Multiple elements display on a single line, each element is separated by a single comma and a single space.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.AddressLabel.UpdateElementsVisibility
member.summary: Updates the elements visibility dependency properties.
member.remarks: WPF elements will occupy space even if the text is not present, we need to set the visibility to collapsed to make sure the elements won't occupy space.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.AddressLabel.SetElementVisibility(System.Windows.DependencyProperty,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the visibility of an specified property based on the value.
member.param: Property whose value needs to be updated.
Value based on which visibility needs to be updated.
member.remarks: Visibility is set to Visible if the value is not null or empty string, else will be set to collapsed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.AddressLabel.AddressDisplayFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the address layout to be either "inform" (vertical) or "inline" (horizontal).
member.remarks: If the address layout is set to "inform", each line contains a single, left-justified element with no separator characters displayed. If the address layout is set to "inline", multiple elements display on a single line, with address elements separated by a single comma and a single space. Individual address elements should not split across multiple lines.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.Common.DateAndTime.CuiDate.IsAddValid(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the add instruction operand has a valid value.
member.param: The string used to check whether the add instruction operand has a valid value.
member.returns: True if the add instruction operand has a valid value; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The test performed is not dependent on the current setting of DateType. This means true is returned if the operand is valid, even if DateType is not Exact or Approximate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.Common.DateAndTime.CuiDate.Add(Microsoft.Cui.Controls.Common.DateAndTime.CuiDate,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a number of months, weeks, days or years to a date.
member.param: The date to be added to.
Add instructions such as +2w to add 2 weeks or -3m to subtract 3 months.
member.remarks: The operand can be positive or negative; if the operand is not included, it is assumed to be positive.
member.exception: If DateType is Year and the unit in the instruction is not DateArithmeticResources.YearsUnit. Or if DateType is YearMonth and the unit in the instruction is not DateArithmeticResources.YearsUnit or DateArithmeticResources.MonthsUnit. Or if the instruction is not of the expected format.
If the set of letters in the DateArithmeticResources is not unique or if values are not each a single character long.

members.member:
Parses a string that represents a time span, with CultureInfo used to parse the string.
A string containing the value to be parsed. A container for a successfully-parsed time span. Specifies whether the timespan should be considered as an age or not. True if the value was successfully converted; otherwise, false. . /// If the string could be parsed, the result parameter is set to an CuiTimeSpan object corresponding to the parsed timeSpanString. If it could not be parsed, the result is set to null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.Common.DateAndTime.CuiTimeSpan.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents a time span.
member.returns: A string that represents the CuiTimeSpan Object.
member.remarks: The string returned by ToString is dependent on the granularity and threshold of the time span. If IsAge is true, Granularity is set from the time span. If IsAge is false, Granularity is set from the assigned Granularity value. Granularity may be seconds, minutes, weeks, hours, days, weeks, months or years.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.Common.DateAndTime.CuiTimeSpan.ToString(Microsoft.Cui.Controls.Common.DateAndTime.TimeSpanUnitLength)
member.summary: Returns a string that represents a time span, with the length of units to be used specified.
member.param: The length of the units to use.
member.returns: A string that represents the CuiTimeSpan Object.
member.remarks: The string returned by ToString is dependent on the granularity and threshold of the time span. If IsAge is true, Granularity is set from the time span. If IsAge is false, Granularity is set from the assigned Granularity value. Granularity may be seconds, minutes, weeks, hours, days, weeks, months or years.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.Common.DateAndTime.CuiTimeSpan.WeeksAreRelevant
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the number of complete weeks represented by the time span.
member.remarks: The Weeks property is a wrapper for the Days property; it does not have its own internal storage. This means an assignment to Weeks is equivalent to an assignment to Days multiplied by 7.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.NhsNumberParseResult
member.summary: Specifies values for possible results of TryParseNhsNumber.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.NhsNumberParseResult.Success
member.summary: The value was successfully parsed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.NhsNumberParseResult.FailedChecksum
member.summary: The value was successfully parsed but did not contain a valid NHS identifier. The value failed a CheckSum calculation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.NhsNumberParseResult.FailedDigitCount
member.summary: The value contained too many or too few digits. A valid NHS identifier must contain exactly 10 non-alphabetic digits which cannot all be the same.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.NhsNumberParseResult.FailedAlphaCharacterContent
member.summary: The value contained alphabetic characters. A valid NHS identifier must contain exactly 10 non-alphabetic digits which cannot all be the same.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.NhsNumberParseResult.FailedAllSameDigits
member.summary: The value digits cannot all be the same. A valid NHS identifier must contain exactly 10 non-alphabetic digits which cannot all be the same.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.NhsNumberParseResult.FailedUnknownReason
member.summary: The value could not be parsed. A valid NHS identifier must contain exactly 10 non-alphabetic digits which cannot all be the same.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.IdentifierLabel.Validate
member.summary: Validates whether a given identifier is a valid NhsNumber.
member.remarks: ArgumentException will be raised if the IdentifierType is NhsNumber and Text is not a valid NhsNumber

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.IdentifierLabel.IdentifierType
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to process the identifier with the NhsNumber validation checksum.
member.remarks: Defaults to "Other". If this is set to "Other", no validation is performed. If this is set to "NhsNumber", the text must be a valid NHS number.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.IdentifierLabel.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text associated with the IdentifierLabel control. Must be set to a valid NhsNumber if the control’s IdentifierType is NhsNumber.
member.remarks: Defaults to "xxx-xxx-xxxx". This property is mandatory if IdentifierType is set to "NhsNumber".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.IdentifierLabel.LastIdentifierValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the last identifier set is a valid identifier.
member.remarks: This will always return true if the IdentifierType is Other.
member.value: Boolean indicating whether the last identifier is valid.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.IdentifierLabel.DisplayValue
member.summary: Gets the formatted Identifier text . If the Identifier is of type NhsNumber, then the identifier will be formatted as a NHS number.
member.remarks: If the IdentifierType is Other, then DisplayValue will be same as Text. If the IdentifierType is NhsNumber, then Identifier will be formatted in the form of a NHS number.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.NhsNumber.TryParseNhsNumber(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of an NHS identifier to its correctly-formatted equivalent.
member.remarks: If parsing fails, the out parsedValue is not changed.
member.param: A string containing an NHS identifier to be parsed.

When this method returns, it contains the formatted NHS identifier equivalent to that contained in value if the conversion succeeded; otherwise it contains the original value. The conversion fails if the value parameter is null or does not contain a valid string representation of an NHS identifier.
member.returns: An NhsNumberParseResult indicating the outcome of the attempted parse operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.NhsNumber.ParseNhsNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of an NHS identifier to its correctly-formatted equivalent.
member.remarks: Throws an exception if the string cannot be parsed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.NameLabel.FamilyName
member.summary: Gets or sets the family name.
member.remarks: The NameLabel control capitalizes the family name. The maximum display length is 40 characters. If the data exceeds 40 characters, it is truncated to 37 characters plus an ellipsis.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.NameLabel.GivenName
member.summary: Gets or sets the given name.
member.remarks: The maximum display length is 40 characters. If the data exceeds 40 characters, it is truncated to 37 characters plus an ellipsis.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.NameLabel.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the patient's title.
member.remarks: The NameLabel control puts parentheses around the title. The title is only dispayed if one of FamilyName or GivenName is provided. The maximum display length is 35 characters, including parentheses and three spaces.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.NameLabel.DisplayValue
member.summary: Gets the constructed name as displayed.
member.remarks: The patient's name takes the form "FAMILYNAME, GivenName (Title)". The maximum total display length is 120 characters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.DecoratorItemsWrapPanel.ArrangeOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary:
Arrange override.
The arrange override works through the text working out where the text is expected to wrap. To work this out, we create a TextBlock on the fly that has the same maximum width as the wrap panel, and start adding a character one at a time until the TextBlock wraps.
The characters are then travered both backwards and forwards to calculate which line in the wrapped TextBlock is responsible for the actual width of the TextBlock. Basically, calculating which is the widest line. This is achieved by creating 2 more TextBlocks, one for the forward pass, and one for the backward pass, and characters are again added one at a time until the width matches that of the first TextBlock.
Once a width match is found, the width of the top line can be calculated. This is then set to be the width of the first text block. Characters are then removed from the end, one by one, until the TextBlock returns to just one line high. The text in that TextBlock then represents one line, and can be arranged.
The differences between WPF and Silverlight here are to do with measuring the TextBlock as characters are added. In Silverlight, the TextBlock's actual size is set immediately. In WPF, we need to call Measure, and then read the desired size.
member.param: The final size for the panel.
member.returns: Returns the size of the panel.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.DecoratorTextBox.ChangeText(Microsoft.Cui.Controls.MatchingTermItemContainer)
member.summary:
Changes the text for a specific term.
This method uses the start index (from term item) to move through the decorator textbox items, and update the text in the item to show the new text. If the new text is longer, more text box items are inserted. If the new text is shorter, text box items are removed.
The text box text is then updated with the change, flagging that the change is a programmatic change. And finally, each term item that comes after the changed item, has the start index updated with its new start position.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.DecoratorTextBox.UpdateTextBoxItems
member.summary:
Updates the text box items.
For each character in the text, a TextBoxItem is created. This collection of TextBoxItems is then bound to the DecoratorItemsControl. Each character in the text can then be individually highlighted.
The method below splits the text box text, and then moves through the existing list of TextBoxItems to identify where the change took place. At the point where the change has taken place, all new characters are inserted, and any existing characters afterwards are removed.
After the TextBoxItems have been updated, any decorators that appear after the change start are cleared. If the change took place at the beginning, or a character is deleted from the middle, then the decorators are refreshed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.DecoratorTextBox.UpdateScrollViewer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the scroll viewer position.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.DecoratorTextBox.ClearDecorators(System.Int32)
member.summary: Clears all of the decorators.
member.param: The index for where to start clearing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.DecoratorTextBox.UpdateItemDecorators
member.summary:
Updates the item decorators.
This moves through the list of current valid terms. If each term's start index + length is within the count of text box items, then the term is assigned to each of the text items it covers.
The position of the text item in relation to the term is also set allowing different visual states for characters that are at the beginning, middle or end of a term.
The 'displayed matching terms' collection is also updated, so that UI outside of the text box can display a list of matching terms.
Any term that is outside of the bounds of the text items count is also removed from the valid terms collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.IndentedLabel.UpdateLabel
member.summary:
Updates the text displayed in the control.
The method is used to work out where to wrap the text, creating a string for each line and finally adding a textblock to a stack panel for each line. When calculating the wrapping, the indentation size and ellipses size is taken into account also.
The arrange override works through the text working out where the text is expected to wrap. To work this out, we create a TextBlock on the fly that has the same maximum width as the wrap panel, and start adding a character one at a time until the TextBlock wraps.
The actual width of the text block is then set to be the Width of the text block. Characters are then removed from the end, one by one, until the TextBlock returns to just one line high. The text in that TextBlock then represents one line. The string can then be stored as a line, and once each line is found, added to a stack panel of text blocks.
The differences between WPF and Silverlight here are to do with measuring the TextBlock as characters are added. In Silverlight, the TextBlock's actual size is set immediately. In WPF, we need to call Measure, and then read the desired size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.TimeLabel.Display12Hour
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the hours value should be displayed in 12-hour or 24-hour format.
member.value: True hours value is displayed in 12-hour format.Falsehours value is displayed in 24-hour format.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.TimeLabel.DisplayAMPM
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an AM/PM suffix should be included.
member.value: Truespecifies an AM/PM suffix is included.Falsespecifies an AM/PM suffix is not included.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.TimeLabel.DisplaySeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether seconds should be displayed.
member.value: Trueseconds is displayed.Falseseconds is not displayed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.TimeLabel.NullIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets a number identifying a null index type (defaults to -1). The index has no intrinsic meaning by itself. The meaning is implied by the UI control.

member.summary: Gets or sets the null strings.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cui.Controls.TimeLabel.TimeValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the time value.
member.remarks: It is recommended that the property TimeValue be used while specifying values through XAML. Example:TimeValue="11:30:20". The Value property cannot be initialized in this manner due to absence of a custom type converter that can convert a string to a valid instance of CuiTime.
